intro: Dianthus brachyanthus, commonly known as the mountain pink, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its clusters of showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a compact, evergreen growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or alpine settings. Its botanical features make it a popular choice among gardeners seeking ornamental plants with hardy characteristics.
